summary:
Summary of ASX Announcement (Form 603 – Initial Substantial Shareholder Notice)

Key Material Information:

  1. Substantial Shareholder:

  2. BlackRock Group (via multiple subsidiaries) has disclosed a new substantial holding in Downer EDI Ltd (DOW).

  3. Total Holdings:

  4. Aggregate voting rights: Not explicitly totaled in the document, but multiple subsidiaries hold millions of shares.

  5. Key holdings by entity (Ordinary Shares):

    • BlackRock Institutional Trust Company: 6,415,788 (largest single holding).
    • BlackRock Investment Management (Australia): 5,935,999, 3,655,733, 1,405,254, etc.
    • BlackRock Fund Advisors: 8,207,862.

  6. Nature of Interest:

  7. Acquired through market purchases (on-market buys) and in-specie transfers.

  8. Some securities held under securities lending agreements (collateral transfers).

  9. Purchase Details (Selected Examples):

  10. Recent purchases (July 2025) at prices ranging from AUD 6.83–6.93, with significant volumes.

  11. Example:

    • BlackRock Institutional Trust Company bought 173,056 shares @ AUD 6.25 (17-Jun-25).
    • BlackRock Investment Management bought 157,919 shares @ AUD 6.40 (2-Jul-25).

  12. Securities Lending Agreements:

  13. BlackRock entities have agreements with multiple global banks (e.g., JPMorgan, Goldman Sachs, UBS).

  14. Borrowers hold voting rights under collateral arrangements (restricted unless instructed).

  15. Association:

  16. All subsidiaries are controlled by BlackRock Inc. (USA).

Trading Implications:

  • Significant accumulation by a major institutional investor (bullish signal).
  • Liquidity impact: Large on-market purchases may tighten supply.

Omitted:

  • Non-material transactional details (small trades, administrative boilerplate).

Conclusion: BlackRock has built a substantial stake in DOW through market purchases and lending arrangements, indicating institutional interest.
